page.title: 05EMPLOYMENT IN MIDMAR
page.content: When the oil related people came, digger contractors, architects, builders and also agricultural contractors who also live in Midmar, helped newcomers to build houses.The oil men travel into Aberdeen or Dyce to work.There is also a lot of land in Midmar used by farmers for cows, sheep and cereals.There are woods all around Midmar so quite a few people are involved with forestry.There is one resident who owns a sawmill and chops down trees to be made into palettes to take paper to America.He employs six local men.There are also jobs connected with the school such as a cleaner and meals server.There is a taxi service that takes children to and from school and delivers the meals.Another resident of Midmar drives a bakery van.
